content.title: Supply of Invalid Carriages (Motorized Tri-cycles) to the Persons With Disabilities
content.details: The scheme 'Supply of Invalid Carriages (Motorized Tri-cycles) to the Persons With Disabilities' by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry is introduced to supply invalid carriages (motorised tricycles) free of cost to the differently abled persons who are engaged in gainful employment or who are pursuing higher / professional / technical education.
benefits: Invalid carriages (Motorized Tricycles) are provided free of cost to the persons with disabilities.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Native/Resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least 5 years.
The annual income of the applicant should not exceed â‚¹ 75,000/- per annum.
The applicant should have a locomotor disability affecting lower limbs to a degree not less than 65%.
The applicant should be certified by the Medical Authority that he/she is fit for operating the invalid carriage (motor tricycle).
The applicant should not be in receipt of transport allowance for conveyance from the Department or any other source.
The applicant should be in gainful employment or pursuing higher studies.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. The interested applicant should visit the Office/ Sub-Office of the Department of Social Welfare to request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form or take print of the prescribed format of the application form.
documents_required: Residence-cum-Nativity Certificate, issued by the competent authority
Bonafide Certificate from Institution or Working Certificate

faqs.question: Where can one find the Citizen's Charter for detailed information?
faqs.answer: For detailed information, refer to the Citizen's Charter at https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sites/default/files/citizen-charter.pdf.

faqs.question: What type of disabilities are considered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme focuses on individuals with locomotor disabilities affecting lower limbs to a degree not less than 65%.

faqs.question: In case of delayed benefits disbursal, who should be contacted in Puducherry?
faqs.answer: For Puducherry, contact the Director, Directorate of Social Welfare. For Karaikal, contact the Collector. For Mahe/Yanam, contact the Regional Administrator.

faqs.question: Is transport allowance from any other source a disqualifying factor for applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants should not be in receipt of transport allowance from the Department or any other source.

faqs.question: What platform can be used for grievance redressal related to the scheme?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be addressed on https://pgportal.gov.in/.

faqs.question: How can one track the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Applicants can track their application status on https://edistrict.py.gov.in/User/TrackApplication.aspx.

faqs.question: What are the key benefits offered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Persons with disabilities receive motorized tricycles free of cost to facilitate their mobility.

faqs.question: What role does the Medical Authority play in the application process?
faqs.answer: Applicants need certification from the Medical Authority, confirming their fitness to operate the motor tricycle.

faqs.question: Is there a specific age criterion for applicants seeking the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria focus on residency, income, disability percentage, and employment or education status, with no specific age restrictions mentioned.

faqs.question: Can an applicant receive the tricycle if they are not in gainful employment but are pursuing higher education?
faqs.answer: Yes, individuals pursuing higher studies are eligible even if not in gainful employment, emphasizing the scheme's support for education.

faqs.question: How long should the individual reside in Puducherry in order to become eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The individual should reside in Puducherry for at least 5 years in order to become eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there sub-offices where applicants can seek assistance?
faqs.answer: Applicants can visit the Sub Offices of the Social Welfare Department, Puducherry, listed at https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sub--office-social-welfare-department for assistance.
